maml:description.maml:para: Disables remote desktop access to a hosted service
Disables remote desktop access to a hosted service. You must publish the service using the Publish-AzureServiceProject cmdlet after disabling remote desktop access for the change to take effect.

Enable memcached for the specified web role, configured to communicate with the specified dedicated cache role
The name of the web role that will use the cache
The name of the dedicated cache worker role, created with Add-AzureCacheWorkerRole
The cache runtime version
The name of the web role that will use the cache
The name of the dedicated cache worker role, created with Add-AzureCacheWorkerRole
The cache runtime version

dev:remarks.maml:para: Enables memcached in web role WebRole1, using dedicated caching role WorkerRole1
Enables memcached in worker role WorkerRole1, using dedicated caching role CacheWorkerRole

maml:description.maml:para: Enables remote desktop access to a hosted service
Enables remote desktop access to a hosted service. You must publish the service using the Publish-AzureServiceProject cmdlet after enabling remote desktop access for the change to take effect.
The username credential you will use when connecting to the azure role instance via RDP. The cmdlet will prompt you for a password.
The username credential you will use when connecting to the azure role instance via RDP. The cmdlet will prompt you for a password.
Get the runtimes available to install in a role
Gets the runtimes available to install in a role.
The name of the runtime. If a runtime specified, only the specific versions of that runtime available to install in your role in Azure will be returned.
The name of the runtime. If a runtime specified, only the specific versions of that runtime available to install in your role in Azure will be returned.
Creates scaffolding for a new service
Creates the necessary files and configuration for a new Windows Azure service in the current directory

The name of the service - determines the leftmost portion of the hostname for your service (i.e. <Name>.cloudapp.net), and the directory that will contain your service. Must contain only letters, digits, and the dash character (-).

The name of the service - determines the leftmost portion of the hostname for your service (i.e. <Name>.cloudapp.net), and the directory that will contain your service. Must contain only letters, digits, and the dash character (-).

dev:remarks.maml:para: Create scaffolding for a new Windows Azure service named "MyService1" in the current directory.

maml:description.maml:para: Publish the current service to the cloud

Publish the current service to the cloud. Publishing configuration (Subscription, StorageAccountName, Location, Slot) can be specified on the command line, or in local settings via the Set-AzureServiceProject commands.

The Windows Azure subscription name to be used while deploying this service. If no Subscription parameter is specified, the value will be taken from the last Set-AzureServiceProject command issued for this service, or, if no subscription was ever specified, it will default to the first subscription listed in the current windows Azure publish profile.

The name to be used for the service when publishing to the cloud. The name determines the subdomain label in the cloudapp.net subdomain that will be used to address the service when hosted in Azure (that is, <Name>.cloudapp.net). Any name specified while publishing the service will override the name given when creating the service (see the New-AzureServiceProject commandlet).

The Windows Azure storage account name to be used while publishing the service to the cloud. This value is not used until the service is published to the cloud. If no storage account name is provided, the storage account specified by the last call to Set-AzureServiceProject will be used. If no storage account was ever specified, a storage account matching the name of the service will be used. If no such storage account exists, the commandlet will attempt to create a new one - this may fail if a storage account matching the service name exists in another subscription.

The region in which the application will be hosted. Possible values are: Anywhere Asia, Anywhere Europe, Anywhere US, East Asia, East US, North Central US, North Europe, South Central US, Southeast Asia, West Europe, West US. If no Location is specified, the location specified in the last call to Set-AzureServiceProject will be used. If no Location was ever specified, the Location will be randomly chosen from 'North Central US' and 'South Central US' locations.

The deployment slot to be used for this service. Possible values are 'Staging' and 'Production'. If no slot is specified, the slot provided in the last call to Set-AzureDeploymentSlot will be used. If no slot was ever specified, the 'Production' slot will be used.
If specified, launch a browser window to view the application after it is deployed to Azure
The timeout in seconds for service deployment operations
Publish service without confirmation prompts

command:parameter.maml:name: Subscription

maml:description.maml:para: The Windows Azure subscription name to be used while deploying this service. If no Subscription parameter is specified, the value will be taken from the last Set-AzureServiceProject command issued for this service, or, if no subscription was ever specified, it will default to the first subscription listed in the current windows Azure publish profile.

command:parameter.dev:defaultValue: value taken from current service settings or the current publish profile

maml:description.maml:para: The name to be used for the service when publishing to the cloud. The name determines the subdomain label in the cloudapp.net subdomain that will be used to address the service when hosted in Azure (that is, <Name>.cloudapp.net). Any name specified while publishing the service will override the name given when creating the service (see the New-AzureServiceProject commandlet).

command:parameter.maml:name: StorageAccountName

maml:description.maml:para: The Windows Azure storage account name to be used while publishing the service to the cloud. This value is not used until the service is published to the cloud. If no storage account name is provided, the storage account specified by the last call to Set-AzureServiceProject will be used. If no storage account was ever specified, a storage account matching the name of the service will be used. If no such storage account exists, the commandlet will attempt to create a new one - this may fail if a storage account matching the service name exists in another subscription.

command:parameter.dev:defaultValue: Value taken from the current service settings or the current publish profile

maml:description.maml:para: The region in which the application will be hosted. Possible values are: Anywhere Asia, Anywhere Europe, Anywhere US, East Asia, East US, North Central US, North Europe, South Central US, Southeast Asia, West Europe, West US. If no Location is specified, the location specified in the last call to Set-AzureServiceProject will be used. If no Location was ever specified, the Location will be randomly chosen from 'North Central US' and 'South Central US' locations.

The deployment slot to be used for this service. Possible values are 'Staging' and 'Production'. If no slot is specified, the slot provided in the last call to Set-AzureDeploymentSlot will be used. If no slot was ever specified, the 'Production' slot will be used.
If specified, launch a browser window to view the application after it is deployed to Azure
The timeout in seconds for service deployment operations
Publish service without confirmation prompts

dev:remarks.maml:para: Publishes the current service, using the current service settings and the current Azure publish profile

maml:description.maml:para: Removes the current hosted service
Stops and removes the current hosted service, or the service matching the specified service and subscription name.
The name of the service to be removed. If the command is run from a service directory and no name is specified, uses the current service name.

The subscription name that was used to host the service. If no subscription is specified, uses the subscription specified in the last call to Set-AzureDeploymentSubscription. If no subscription was ever specified, uses the first subscription in the current Azure publish profile.
Remove service without confirmation prompts
The name of the service to be removed. If the command is run from a service directory and no name is specified, uses the current service name.

The subscription name that was used to host the service. If no subscription is specified, uses the subscription specified in the last call to Set-AzureDeploymentSubscription. If no subscription was ever specified, uses the first subscription in the current Azure publish profile.
Remove service without confirmation prompts
Sets default location, subscription, slot, and storage account for the current service
Sets the deployment location, slot, storage account, and subscription for the current service. These values are used whenever the service is published to the cloud.

The region in which the service will be hosted. This value is used whenever the service is published to the cloud. Possible values are: Anywhere Asia, Anywhere Europe, Anywhere US, East Asia, East US, North Central US, North Europe, South Central US, Southeast Asia, West Europe, West US.
The slot (production or staging) in which the service will be hosted. This value is used whenever the service is published to the cloud. Possible values are: Production, Staging.
The storage account to be used when uploading the service package to the cloud. If the storage account doesn't exist, it will be created when the service is published to the cloud.

The subscription that will host the service in the cloud. This value is used whenever the service is published to the cloud. You will need to register credentials for this subscription by using the Import-AzurePublishSettingsFile commandlet.

The region in which the service will be hosted. This value is used whenever the service is published to the cloud. Possible values are: Anywhere Asia, Anywhere Europe, Anywhere US, East Asia, East US, North Central US, North Europe, South Central US, Southeast Asia, West Europe, West US.
The slot (production or staging) in which the service will be hosted. This value is used whenever the service is published to the cloud. Possible values are: Production, Staging.
The storage account to be used when uploading the service package to the cloud. If the storage account doesn't exist, it will be created when the service is published to the cloud.

The subscription that will host the service in the cloud. This value is used whenever the service is published to the cloud. You will need to register credentials for this subscription by using the Import-AzurePublishSettingsFile commandlet.

command:example.maml:title: -------------- Basic Settings --------------
command:example.dev:code: Set-AzureServiceProject -Location "North Central US" -Slot Production -Storage myStorageAccount -Subscription myAzureSubscription

dev:remarks.maml:para: Sets the deployment location for the service to the North Central US region. Sets the deloyment slot to Production. Sets the storage account ahat will be used to stage the service definition to 'myStorageAccount'. Sets the subscription that will host the service to 'mySubscription'. Whenever the service is published to the cloud, it will be hosted in a data center in the North Central US region, it will update the deployment slot, and it will use the specified subscription and storage account.

maml:description.maml:para: Starts both the compute and storage emulators and hosts the current service in the compute emulator
Starts both the compute and storage emulators and executes the service
Open a new browser window on the service after hosting it in the emulator
Open a new browser window on the service after hosting it in the emulator

dev:remarks.maml:para: Executes the service in the Azure emulator and launches a new browser window on the emulated service

maml:description.maml:para: Starts the specified hosted service in Azure
Starts the specified hosted service in the cloud, if the service is in the stopped state. Note that the Publish-AzureServiceProject command will attempt to automatically start the service
The name of the hosted service to start. If no name is specified, starts the current hosted service.
The deployment slot (Staging, Production) to start the service in
The subscription to use when starting the specified service
The name of the hosted service to start. If no name is specified, starts the current hosted service.
The deployment slot (Staging, Production) to start the service in
The subscription to use when starting the specified service
Stops the compute emulator
Stops the Windows Azure compute emulator. Any services currently executing in the emulator will be removed.
Stops the current hosted service
Stops the current hosted service in the specified slot in Windows Azure. If no slot is specified, stops the service in the Production slot
The name of the hosted service to stop. If no name is specified, stops the current hosted service.
The slot where the service is hosted. If no slot is specified, 'Production' is assumed.
The subscription to use when stopping the specified service.
The name of the hosted service to stop. If no name is specified, stops the current hosted service.
The slot where the service is hosted. If no slot is specified, 'Production' is assumed.
The subscription to use when stopping the specified service.
Tests whether a Windows Azure cloud service name, storage service name or service bus namespace name exists or not.
If the name exists, the cmdlet returns $True. If the name does not exist, it returns $False.
Specifies to test for an existing cloud service.
Specifies the name of the cloud service to test.
Specifies to test for an existing storage service.
Specifies the name of the storage account to test.
Specifies to test for an existing service bus namespace.
Specifies the name of the service bus namespace to test.
Specifies the name of the service or storage account to test.
Specifies to test for an existing service account.
Specifies to test for an existing storage account.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command tests to see if the "MyNameService1" is an existing Windows Azure cloud service name.
This command tests to see if the "mystorename1" is an existing Windows Azure storage service name.
This command tests to see if the "mynamespace" is an existing Windows Azure service bus namespace name.
